info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:59PM CDT until June 08 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GUADALUPE...NORTHEASTERN BEXAR AND COMAL COUNTIES... At 158 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Smithson Valley, or 10 miles southwest of Canyon Lake Dam, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... New Braunfels, Schertz, Cibolo, Selma, Canyon Lake, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Santa Clara, Guadalupe River State Park, Smithson Valley, Spring Branch, Timberwood Park, Anhalt, Startzville, Bracken, Freiheit, Solms, Gruene, Honey Creek State Natural Area and New Braunfels National Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
